hardFacts.value: Each scene allows for one character; multiple avatars require using different avatars across scenes.

sources.quote: Each scene allows for one character; to use multiple avatars, place different avatars in different scenes.

hardFacts.value: After successful submission, editing requires duplicating (cloning) the video from the 'My Video' tab.

sources.quote: After a video is successfully submitted, editing requires duplicating it (creating a clone) from the ‘My Video’ tab.

hardFacts.value: Paid plans have priority processing; processing time depends on concurrent workload.

sources.quote: Paid-plan users have priority processing time; processing time depends on how many videos are being processed at the same time.

hardFacts.value: Custom Avatars are generated in minutes; Studio Avatar can take up to 7 days end-to-end.

sources.quote: Custom Avatars are automatically generated in a few minutes; a Studio Avatar can take up to 7 days from beginning to end.

hardFacts.value: Users currently cannot control avatars’ gestures and movements.

sources.quote: Currently, users are not able to control avatars’ gestures and movements.

hardFacts.value: Export resolution options include 720p, up to 1080p, and up to 4K depending on plan.

sources.quote: Export resolution options listed include 720P, up to 1080P, and up to 4K (depending on plan).

hardFacts.value: AI studio editor max duration per video is listed as 3 minutes for one plan and 30 minutes for multiple plans.

sources.quote: Max duration per video (AI studio editor) is listed as 3 minutes for one plan and 30 minutes for multiple plans.

hardFacts.value: Video translation max duration per video varies by plan: 3 minutes, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, or no max.

hardFacts.value: Avatar IV max duration per video is listed as 30 seconds for one plan and 3 minutes for multiple plans.

sources.quote: Avatar IV max duration per video is listed as 30 seconds for one plan and 3 minutes for multiple plans.

Terms: Payments are non-refundable, except where required by law.

nuggets.text: You paste a webpage URL and choose a template, aspect ratio, and visual tone to start a video.
HeyGen prepares an initial storyboard automatically after you enter the web link.
HeyGen extracts headlines and copy from the URL and lets you edit or paste a custom script.
You can control voiceover, captions, and scene emphasis by editing the script.
You can adjust imagery, transitions, background music, and voiceover options, and toggle captions.
Rendering handles lip sync, encoding, and creating video files, and you can download files or use the API for batch delivery.
You upload an MP4, MOV, or WebM file to generate captions in HeyGen.
HeyGen analyzes your audio and creates accurate, timestamped captions automatically.
You can edit captions directly in the editor for names, technical terms, or timing adjustments.
Captions can be exported as SRT or VTT files.
You can export a video with burned-in captions for TikTok, Instagram, or Reels.
Caption styling controls include adjusting font, color, size, and placement.
The AI dubbing tool converts speech and syncs lip movements in real time for video localization.
The page states support for 175+ languages and dialects.
You can upload a video file or paste a YouTube link to translate.
The workflow includes selecting a video, choosing a target language, and clicking translate video.
The page describes customizable localization with editable scripts, tone controls, and regional accents plus captions and subtitles.
The page describes uploading a video for hyper-realistic translation with natural lip-sync.
To create your clone, you provide a short visual and voice reference and HeyGen builds an AI avatar that represents you.
You can type or paste the text you want delivered as the script.
You can choose style and language, including visual layout and tone, while keeping identity consistent.
You can generate and export the video, then update the script anytime to generate a new version.
The page states one clone can speak multiple languages while maintaining the same appearance and voice characteristics.
The page states the process is text-driven and designed for non-technical users without editing skills.
The page describes creating a text-to-speech avatar in four steps: choose avatar style, input text, select a voice, then generate and download.
Avatar styles listed include 2D, 3D, or animated avatars.
You input the script text you want the avatar to read, including short messages or long narration.
Voice selection includes choosing tone, accent, and pace, and you can adjust pitch and speed.
The page states clicking Generate creates a lifelike avatar video within minutes and you can download it.
The page states avatars can be added to websites, virtual assistants, and marketing content for both developers and non-technical users.
The page states you can create podcasts instantly by writing or uploading your script, with no microphone needed.
The page states the AI turns text into clear and realistic voices ready for broadcast.
